newsitem.title: USA: USDA earmarks $59 mln for rural water projects.
newsitem.headline: USDA earmarks $59 mln for rural water projects.

text.p: Agriculture Secretary Dan Glickman said Tuesday the agency would spend $69 million to build or improve rural drinking water and sewer systems.

"This round of water-related investments is part of the Clinton Administration's celebration of Earth Day," Glickman said in a statement. The agency will invest the money in 43 communities in 30 states.
An estimated 2.5 million rural Americans have undependable or no access to safe drinking water and about 4 million live with unsanitary sewage disposal, the agency said.

Water-related problems are most common in low-income rural areas, but Glickman said they also exist "in Midwest farming communities, quaint New England towns, and within 50 miles of most major cities."
The USDA has loaned some $14 billion in the past five decades for similar projects.
